csc555.ebratt.depaul.edu

Class RCTop10Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
      • csc555.ebratt.depaul.edu.RCTop10Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool

    public class RCTop10Driver
extends org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
implements org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool
    RCTop10Driver is the hadoop class that drives the program. It is intended as a second step in a mult-step MapReduce application. What this program does is counts the number of occurrences of a word by group and emits the top 10 most-frequently-occurring words in the group.
    Since:
    11/11/2015
    Version:
    11/11/2015
    Author:
    Eric Bratt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RCTop10Driver.RCTop10Mapper
      RCTop10Mapper is the hadoop class that maps the input.
      static class  RCTop10Driver.RCTop10Reducer
      RCTop10Reducer is the hadoop class that reduces the output of the RCTop10Mapper.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public int run(java.lang.String[] args)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Runs the driver by creating a new hadoop Job based on the configuration. Defines the path in/out based on the first two arguments.
        Specified by:
        run in interface org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool
        Parameters:
        args - [0] the input directory on HDFS
        args - [1] the output directory on HDFS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is an issue with any of the arguments

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the entry point to the program. It creates a new Configuration, checks the arguments, deletes the output directory on HDFS (if it already exists), tells hadoop that it wants to compress the mapper output but not the reducer output, and runs the job.
        Parameters:
        args - [0] the input directory on HDFS
        args - [1] the output directory on HDFS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is an issue with any of the arguments
